query='Describe the process and key strategies Felipe Aros employed in the development of the Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) system at Digitaltex. Include details on how he ensured the precision of the system and the role of benchmarking in optimizing its performance.' contexts=['Felipe Aros
Santiago, Chile |569-98254228 |felipe.aros.r@gmail.com |github.com/felipearosr
Professional Summary
Results-driven professional with expertise in Machine Learning Engineering and Software Development. Proven track record
in designing and implementing high-precision Retrieval-Augmented Generation systems, optimizing performance through
rigorous benchmarking. Experienced in engineering web applications and leading AI research projects with successful in-
ternational collaboration. Seeking opportunities to leverage skills in machine learning, software development, and project
leadership for innovative solutions and client satisfaction.
Experience
Generative AI - RAG Systems December 2022 – Present
Digitaltex Santiago, Chile
•Led the development of an advanced Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) system for a prominent client, utilizing
a diverse dataset of over 100 documents to ensure unparalleled precision in information retrieval.
•Demonstrated expertise in grounding large language models (LLMs) on accurate and up-to-date information, sur-
passing client expectations and delivering a highly accurate RAG system.
•Conducted rigorous benchmarking of multiple RAG system iterations, systematically analyzing and comparing per-
formance metrics to optimize efficiency and effectiveness.
•Fostered transparent collaboration with the client throughout the development and benchmarking phases, resulting
in a technically superior RAG system tailored to meet specific needs and expectations.
Machine Learning Engineer June 2022 – December 2022
Gecko Santiago, Chile
•Engineered a web application utilizing an in house ML model to accurately identify and mark road signs in images,
capturing their position, type, and direction.
•Implemented website optimization strategies to enhance overall user experience and performance.
•Executed responsive design principles across the entire web application, ensuring seamless usability across various
devices.
Customer Data Platform (CDP) Development Manager July 2021 – June 2022
Eureka Labs Santiago, Chile
•Led a team in the development and research of Customer Data Platform (CDP) tools, collaborating with international
providers for their implementation in national trade.
•Effectively communicated with software providers worldwide, fostering collaboration with teams from the United
States, Poland, and India.
•Managed and implemented new applications, contributing to improved documentation processes.
•Executed the implementation of diverse CDP services in various e-commerce settings.
Education
Universidad Diego Portales Santiago, Chile
Civil Engineering in Computer Science and Telecommunications Jan. 2018 – Dec. 2023
42 Silicon Valley San Francisco, USA
Study abroad in Computer Science Aug. 2014 – May 2018
Technical Skills
Languages : Python, Java, C/C++, SQL (Postgres), JavaScript, HTML/CSS
Frameworks : React, Node.js, Flask, FastAPI
Developer Tools : Git, Docker, TravisCI, Google Cloud Platform, VS Code, Visual Studio, PyCharm, IntelliJ, Eclipse
Libraries : pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib
Language Proficiency
Spanish : Native
English : Advanced (C1)'] response="Felipe Aros led the development of an advanced Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) system at Digitaltex, focusing on delivering a solution with unparalleled precision in information retrieval. The process began with the utilization of a diverse dataset comprising over 100 documents. This extensive dataset was instrumental in ensuring the RAG system could access a wide range of information, thereby enhancing its precision and relevance in retrieving information.

To ensure the system's precision, Aros demonstrated expertise in grounding large language models (LLMs) on accurate and up-to-date information. This approach was critical in surpassing client expectations by delivering a RAG system that could reliably access and utilize the most relevant and current data available.

Benchmarking played a pivotal role in optimizing the performance of the RAG system. Aros conducted rigorous benchmarking of multiple iterations of the RAG system, systematically analyzing and comparing performance metrics. This methodical approach allowed for the identification of areas for improvement, enabling the team to make informed decisions on how to enhance the system's efficiency and effectiveness.

Throughout the development and benchmarking phases, Aros fostered transparent collaboration with the client. This ensured that the development process was aligned with the client's specific needs and expectations, resulting in a technically superior RAG system tailored to meet those requirements. Through these strategies, Felipe Aros successfully led the development of a high-precision RAG system at Digitaltex, leveraging his expertise in machine learning engineering and software development." passing=True feedback='YES' score=1.0 pairwise_source=None invalid_result=False invalid_reason=None

English : Advanced (C1)'] response="Felipe Aros's study abroad experience at 42 Silicon Valley likely played a significant role in shaping his expertise in Machine Learning Engineering and Software Development, as well as enhancing his project leadership abilities. 42 Silicon Valley is known for its innovative and rigorous approach to teaching computer science, focusing on peer-to-peer learning, hands-on projects, and real-world applications. This environment would have provided Aros with a unique opportunity to immerse himself in the cutting-edge technology ecosystem of Silicon Valley, which is at the forefront of advancements in machine learning and software development.

The hands-on, project-based learning approach at 42 Silicon Valley would have allowed Aros to develop strong practical skills in coding, problem-solving, and software engineering. Working on projects in a collaborative setting would have also honed his ability to work effectively in teams, manage projects, and communicate technical concepts clearly, which are crucial skills for leading AI research projects and engineering web applications as he has done in his professional career.

Furthermore, the exposure to a diverse and innovative tech community in Silicon Valley would have provided Aros with insights into the latest trends, tools, and best practices in machine learning and software development. This exposure is likely to have inspired a results-driven approach to his work, emphasizing the importance of rigorous benchmarking and optimization to achieve high performance, as evidenced by his achievements in developing high-precision Retrieval-Augmented Generation systems and optimizing web application performance.

In summary, Felipe Aros's study abroad experience at 42 Silicon Valley would have significantly contributed to his technical skills, problem-solving abilities, and understanding of the latest trends in machine learning and software development. Additionally, the collaborative and project-based learning environment would have enhanced his project leadership skills, preparing him to lead successful international collaborations and deliver innovative solutions that meet client expectations." passing=True feedback='YES' score=1.0 pairwise_source=None invalid_result=False invalid_reason=None
